topic.title: Fluenta DITA Translation Add-on
topic.shortdesc: This topic describes how to translate DITA project using Fluenta directly from within Oxygen

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Fluenta is a tool designed to simplify the translation of DITA projects. It parses a DITA map, resolves the references to all topics and subtopics and prepares a unified XLIFF file that you can send to your Language Service Provider. The Fluenta DITA Translation Add-on allows you to manage the Fluenta translation workflow directly from within .

section.title: Creating a Fluenta project
section.p:
The first step is to create a Fluenta project.
Open the main ditamap in the DITA Maps Manager
Invoke the contextual menu and select Fluenta Create project...
In the dialog that appears, you need to provide a name for the project and the languages in which the project will be translated. A translation memory with the same name as the project will automatically be created. Also, only one project can be created for a ditamap file. Once created, you will be able to edit it to change certain information. So this action is visible only if there is no project for the opened ditamap.

section.title: Generating XLIFF files
section.p:
When you are ready to send the project to translation, you can generate an XLIFF file like this:
Open the main ditamap in the DITA Maps Manager
Invoke the contextual menu and select Fluenta Generate XLIFF
In the dialog that appears, select the output folder where to generate the XLIFF file(s) and the languages that you want to send to translation.
Use translation memory will use the translation memory associated with the project to recover translations for the segments not yet translated. Reuse ICE matches will compare current content with the content translated in the past and reuse all existing translations. An XLIFF file will be generated in the output folder for each selected language. Also, this action is visible only if there is a project associated with the current ditamap and the XLIFF files will be generated for this project.

section.title: Importing XLIFF
section.p:
Once you receive a translated XLIFF from translation, you need generate a translated version of your project.
Open the main ditamap in the DITA Maps Manager
Invoke the contextual menu and select Fluenta Import XLIFF
In the dialog that appears, browse for the XLIFF file:

note.p: A translated version of the project content will be created in the indicated output folder. If your images are not in SVG format, you will have copy them to the new generated project. Also, this action is visible only if there is a project associated with the current ditamap.

section.title: Editing a Fluenta project
section.p:
Sometimes after creating a project, certain information needs to be edited. The steps are similar to those for creating a new project:
Open the main ditamap in the DITA Maps Manager
Invoke the contextual menu and select Fluenta Edit project "{ProjectName}"
In the dialog that appears, you need to replace the project information you want updated. It is not recommended to edit the name of a project or its source language because they may appear inconsistent with the associated translation memory.
